PyAutoExcel.Tiny.HtmlWriter module

Write table into .html files.

class PyAutoExcel.Tiny.HtmlWriter.TBL_HTMLWriter(table_name: str, data: list[list], generator: type = <class 'PyAutoExcel.TableGenerator.BasicTableGenerator'>)

Bases: object

This class represents a writer for generating HTML tables from data.

Parameters:

  • table_name (str) – The name of the table.

  • data (list[list]) – The data to be written into the table.

property contents

Get the HTML contents of the table.

Returns:

The HTML contents of the table.

Return type:

str

write(file: str | FileIO)

Write the HTML contents of the table to a file.

Parameters:

file (Union[str, io.FileIO]) – The file to write the HTML contents to.

PyAutoExcel.Tiny.ImageWriter module

Write table into pictures. Need ‘pdfkit’ and ‘wkhtmltox’ to run.

raises ModuleNotFoundError:

If ‘imgkit’ package or ‘wkhtmltox’ is not found.

class PyAutoExcel.Tiny.ImageWriter.IMGKIT_ImageWriter

Bases: object

Image writer class using imgkit to generate pictures.

Variables:

  • _options – Dictionary containing image generation options.

  • _html_content – HTML content to be converted to pictures.

image_option(opt_name: str, opt)

Set a image generation option.

Parameters:

  • opt_name (str) – The name of the option.

  • opt (any) – The value of the option.

Returns:

self

table(name: str, data: list[list], html_generator: type = <class 'PyAutoExcel.TableGenerator.BasicTableGenerator'>)

Set up data tables.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the table.

  • data (list[list]) – The data to be displayed in the table.

  • html_generator (type) – The HTML generator class to be used.

Returns:

self

write(file: str)

Write the table to an image file.

Parameters:

file (str) – The path to save the image file.

PyAutoExcel.Tiny.OpenSpreadSheetWriter module

class PyAutoExcel.Tiny.OpenSpreadSheetWriter.OpenSpreadSheetWriter(file_name='', stream=None)

Bases: object

A class for writing data to an OpenDocument Spreadsheet (ODS) file.

Parameters:

  • file_name (str) – The name of the ODS file.

  • stream (file-like object, optional) – The stream to write to. If not provided, a file with the given name will be created, defaults to None.

close()

Closes the ODS file and the associated stream if it was created internally.

create_sheet(sheet_name: str, ncolumns: int | None = None)

Creates a new sheet in the ODS file.

Parameters:

  • sheet_name (str) – The name of the new sheet.

  • ncolumns (int, optional) – The number of columns in the new sheet, defaults to None.

write(sheet_name: str, data: list[list])

Writes multiple rows of data to the specified sheet.

Parameters:

  • sheet_name (str) – The name of the sheet to write to.

  • data (list[list]) – The data to write, where each element is a list representing a row.

write_row(sheet_name: str, row: list)

Writes a single row to the specified sheet.

Parameters:

  • sheet_name (str) – The name of the sheet to write to.

  • row (list) – The row data to write.

PyAutoExcel.Tiny.PdfWriter module

Write table into .pdf files. Need ‘pdfkit’ and ‘wkhtmltox’ to run.

raises ModuleNotFoundError:

If ‘pdfkit’ package or ‘wkhtmltox’ is not found.

class PyAutoExcel.Tiny.PdfWriter.PDFKIT_PdfWriter

Bases: object

PDF writer class using pdfkit to generate PDF files.

Variables:

  • _options – Dictionary containing PDF generation options.

  • _html_content – HTML content to be converted to PDF.

pdf_option(opt_name: str, opt)

Set a PDF generation option.

Parameters:

  • opt_name (str) – The name of the option.

  • opt (any) – The value of the option.

Returns:

self

  • data (list[list]) – The data to be displayed in the table.

  • html_generator (type) – The HTML generator class to be used.

self
